other_tests.findings: Sinus tachycardia at a rate of 115, with nonspecific ST-segment and T-wave abnormalities.

Marked prolapse of the middle and medial scallops of the anterior mitral-valve leaflet, failure of coaptation of the central scallops, severe mitral regurgitation, and abnormal contraction of the posteromedial papillary muscle.
Cardiac output was 2.54 liters per minute, with pulmonary vascular resistance of 189 dyn·sec·cm⁻⁵ and total peripheral resistance of 535 dyn·sec·cm⁻⁵.
The mitral valve was replaced; the posteromedial papillary muscle was necrotic due to infarction.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Immediate postoperative impairment in pulmonary gas exchange resolved within 24 hours.
